lines.text: I am Myra Breckinridge, whom no man will ever possess. The new woman whose astonishing history started with a surgeon's scalpel, and will end... who-knows-where. Just as Eve was born from Adam's rib, so Myron died to give birth to Myra. Did Myron take his own life, you will ask? Yes, and no, is my answer. Beyond that, my lips are sealed. Let it suffice for me to say that Myron is... with me, and that I am the fulfillment of all his dreams. Who is Myra Breckinridge? What is she? Myra Breckinridge is a dish, and don't you ever forget it, you motherfuckers - as the children say nowadays.
It's a dangerous thing, ambition. Ruined Mickey Mouse's whole career.
[first lines]

[sings to himself]
A secret place known to none but me. And in my secret place, you can beg and torture me. I wouldn't tell you where to go. 'Cause in my secret place, secret place, a secret you know. Secret place, a secret you know.
[Surgeon enters to applause]
You realize, once we cut it off, it won't grow back. I mean, it isn't like hair, or fingernails, or toenails, you know.
What do you think I am, some kind of idiot? I know that!

[shrugs]
Eh - how about circumcision? It'd be cheaper.
Come on, come on, come on, let's get it over with, Myra's waiting!

[shrugs]
We'll have to blow up your tits with silicone.
I thought they used paraffin.
No, that would make them inflammable. You wouldn't want inflammable tits, now, do you?

[sighs, then sings]
I got a secret place known to none but me. And in my secret...

[Indistinct]
Cleaver.
[Clear]
I mean scalpel.
Well, I should think so.
Well, wish me luck. I've never done one of these before.

[sings]
You can beg and torture me. I wouldn't care.
[applause]
Where are my tits? Where are my tits?
My purpose in coming to Hollywood is the destruction of the American male in all its particulars.
You have a lot to learn. All you men have a lot to learn. And I have taken it upon myself to teach you.
What do you mean?
This is the most important part of your education. The part your teachers fail to instruct you in. It's called balling.
I know how to do that!
That's what you think. Did you know you have a temperature?
No I didn't!
Well you do. But no matter. I shall cure what's wrong with you.
What are you gonna do?
I shall ball you rusty. It's very simple.
[Letitia has been pulled over by a policeman]
Don't forget to remind me about the policeman's balls - I mean police show!
How should a man act?
He should ball chicks, that's how.
Oh, that feels real good, honey.
You unmitigated piece of shit!
In my country, to wait for love is like to burn by inches.
You're the best salesman since Columbus.
He was a good lover, too?
Yeah, he raised hell-a with Isabella.
Wel, the end of another busy day. I can't wait till I get back to bed. If that don't work I'll try to sleep.
Your goal is...
My goal is the destruction of the last vestigial traces of traditional manhood...
In order to...
Realign the sexes...
While...
Decreasing the population...
Thus...
Increasing human happiness...
And...
Preparing humanity for its next stage.
Bravo. Also... bullshit.
[Rusty is strapped to a table, bent-over]
You think that being a man is such a simple thing. A man would ball chicks you said. Well I tried to explain it to you but you wouldn't listen, so I'm afraid you require a practical demonstration.
[Myra puts on a strap-on, off screen, but it's rather obvious]
Oh my God! Jesus, You'll kill me!

I won't kill you, Rusty. I'll just educate you! You and the rest of America. Must be demonstrated to you practically, that there is no such thing as manhood. It died with Burt Lancaster in "Vera Cruz". Your manhood was taken by Errol Flynn and Clark Gable! I am only going to supply you with the finishing touches.
[Myra and Mary Ann are in bed together]
If only there was some man like you. I'd really fall, I would. But not like this. If only you were a man...
[Myra talks to talent agent Leticia Van Allen]

You see, Miss Van Allen, Uncle Buck and I deal in myths, and movie stars are like gods and goddesses. When one fades, another promptly takes its place, because the human race require that the Pantheon always be filled. And you and I must seek out the glittering few that are the new stars, of our race, reborn!
The point is, can you prove you were married, that's all!
Proof will arrive before the end of the week in the person of Dr Randolph Spencer Montag.
Montag? The great dental psychiatrist?
What's that?
Swedish massage.
[She tries a whip, slapping her hand with it]
What do you... do with it.
I beat you with it.
[She slaps her hand again]
Does it... hurt?
You bet your ass.
Something's wrong here, someplace...
[talent agent Leticia Van Allen is in her office with a young male client]
Well, I don't care about your credits as long as you're oversexed.
Oh, that's one of my credits!
[a curtain goes up behind Leticia, revealing a bed]
A bed! I never did see a bed in an office before.
Well, you see I, I do a lot of night work sometimes.
Gentlemen... I am Myron Breckinridge! Uncle Buck, your fag nephew became your niece two years ago in Copenhagen and is now free as a bird and happy in being the most extraordinary woman in the world!
That's the ball game.

[after raping Rusty]
Well, aren't you going to thank me for all the trouble I've taken?
Thank you, ma'am.
American women are eager for men to rape them. And vice versa.
How tall are you when you're off your horse, cowboy?
Um, six feet, seven inches, ma'am.
Well, never mind the six feet, and let's talk about the seven inches.
How's it goin' ladies?
Just great swweeetie.
Playin' Canasta?
That's right swweeetie.
How's your Poker game going swweeetie?
Jus' fine.
Stand up when a woman comes in the room, you son of a bitch!
It doesn't take much, c'mon get your fill of it! Do something just for the thrill of it!
Oh, Leticia, they don't call you the queen of the casting couch for nothing.
Hm, from what I understand, they're voting me a special Academy Award.
An Oscar?
No. A golden phallus. And let me tell you, one day we'll have our own stable of studs.
A steady stream of sturdy studs!
Hm, a boy bank where credit is always good. Sort of a layered day plan.
God bless America!
God help America!
What you have assembled here are the national dregs, the misfits and neurotics. In short, the fuckups of our culture.
That ain't so. They are the carefully selected candidates for future stardom.
Bullshit!
You can't talk to me like that, young lady. I'll have you outta here so fast, your hair'll curl.
You just try it and I'll take this place away from you lock, stock and empathy class.

[after punching Uncle Buck]
That, students, was a classic stage slap delivered so as to give the impression that the subject has been hit very hard in the mouth. It was first developed by Patricia Collinge in The Little Foxes, 1941.
[Uncle Buck is walking dazed out of the room]
Oh. Thank you for the demonstration, Uncle Buck.
[everyone claps]
Why are you so fascinated by the girl?
But having raped Rusty's manhood, I must now complete the cycle and seduce his girl. Only then will my victory be complete. Thus exerting power over both sexes and, indeed, over life itself.
You impressed me immensely. I'll keep you in mind as a summer replacement. Next.
[last lines]

[voiceover]
I'll turn around and I'll come back. You wouldn't understand the way I feel about Mary Ann. That she's Donald Duck straws and Pepsodent toothpaste.
[first title card]
[script, crawl, before first lines]

I must write it all down. Exactly as it happened. While it is fresh in my memory. But my hand trembles. Why? Twice I've dropped the yellow ball point pen. Now I sit at the surgical table making the greatest effort to calm myself, to put it all down not only for its own sake but also for you, Randolph, who never dreamed that anyone could ever act out
[triple underline]
totally
[end underline]
his fantasies and survive... / Myron Breckinridge
